posts.post_content: This costs five, [absorb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=absorb) costs three. That's why this is crap, and absorb is good. There is a huge difference between five and three mana for a counterspell. Heck, for one more mana you can get a [spelljack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=spelljack).

Posted By: kajillion (9/26/2012 11:47:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A friend was arguing that this was better than [Cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cancel).   
  
"Well, you gain 5 life, and can be played in a White deck!" he said.   
  
I presented [Absorb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Absorb), and said, "I'd like permission to present evidence", and then in a fake judge voice, holding the card, "Permission Granted".   
"Thank you, judge. May the jury see exhibit A: [Absorb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Absorb). A decent counter spell, but one that is not played very often. This just goes to show that even though a spell can gain you life, having two colours and costing more than [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) is not popular."  
  
I suppose my whole skit didn't work, because he's still playing it.   
  
Weirdly, he thinks [Judge's Familiar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Judge's Familiar) is awful. "But they can stop the effect if they just pay an extra ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)."  
 It's a good thing he's willing to trade them for this.
posts.html:
A friend was arguing that this was better than Cancel.

"Well, you gain 5 life, and can be played in a White deck!" he said.

I presented Absorb, and said, "I'd like permission to present evidence", and then in a fake judge voice, holding the card, "Permission Granted".
"Thank you, judge. May the jury see exhibit A: Absorb. A decent counter spell, but one that is not played very often. This just goes to show that even though a spell can gain you life, having two colours and costing more than Counterspell is not popular."

I suppose my whole skit didn't work, because he's still playing it.

Weirdly, he thinks Judge's Familiar is awful. "But they can stop the effect if they just pay an extra ."
It's a good thing he's willing to trade them for this.

posts.post_content:
Feels like one of those cards from early in the game, when lifegain was a Big Deal and had to be frighteningly overpriced. That fact that it is direct-line inferior in nearly ever case to Absorb, a spell which itself is good but not game-breaking, is rather sad.  
  
At least have it grant 7 life or something. Sure, it would still not be played, but at least the higher cost would make some sense.

Posted By: Volvor (11/11/2012 12:07:55 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
People who didn't play Invasion draft don't realize that [Absorb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Absorb) in draft pretty much forced you to stay in two colors or "was a five drop" in 3 colors. This isn't a first pick in draft, but it is a hard counter for any spell and gives you life. Situational, sure, but there are a fair amount of situations where this is a great blowout/bomb.  
  
Say you end up against the Rakdos fast deck. Since this card doesn't require you play two colors like [Absorb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Absorb), let's say you splashed green. So you curve [Call of the Conclave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Call of the Conclave) into [Azorius Keyrune](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Azorius Keyrune) and leave your mana open. At worst, you've got 2 blockers, at best, you counter their 4 or 5 drop and gain life.  
  
 This card sets you up to play an extra 2 bombs in draft that you can't normally play because the format is just barely too fast to play bombs ala Rise of the Eldrazi. The trick to midrange formats is to push just fast enough that the midrange decks can't recover,... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
People who didn't play Invasion draft don't realize that Absorb in draft pretty much forced you to stay in two colors or "was a five drop" in 3 colors. This isn't a first pick in draft, but it is a hard counter for any spell and gives you life. Situational, sure, but there are a fair amount of situations where this is a great blowout/bomb.

Say you end up against the Rakdos fast deck. Since this card doesn't require you play two colors like Absorb, let's say you splashed green. So you curve Call of the Conclave into Azorius Keyrune and leave your mana open. At worst, you've got 2 blockers, at best, you counter their 4 or 5 drop and gain life.

This card sets you up to play an extra 2 bombs in draft that you can't normally play because the format is just barely too fast to play bombs ala Rise of the Eldrazi. The trick to midrange formats is to push just fast enough that the midrange decks can't recover,... (see all)

posts.post_content: Really underwhelming, and honestly, how many "Counter spell, gain life" spells do we need? [Absorb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Absorb), [Overrule](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overrule), [Offering to Asha](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Offering to Asha), etc. Why not "Counter target spell and exile it" for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol). Yes, that is basically [Dissipate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dissipate), but exile is much more in white and Azorious's flavor than crappy life gain.
posts.html:
Really underwhelming, and honestly, how many "Counter spell, gain life" spells do we need? Absorb, Overrule, Offering to Asha, etc. Why not "Counter target spell and exile it" for . Yes, that is basically Dissipate, but exile is much more in white and Azorious's flavor than crappy life gain.
